macro.name: VIX index
macro.note: VIX is moderate at 19.50. Volatility is starting to increase.

macro.name: Gold price (GLD)
macro.note: Gold (GLD) is rallying sharply at $366.07. Indicates rising inflation expectations or systemic risk.

macro.name: EUR/USD exchange rate
macro.note: EUR/USD is stable at 1.1551. Indicates balanced global risk/economic outlook.

macro.name: WTI crude oil ($/bbl)
macro.note: WTI Crude at $59.75/bbl. Low price indicates global slowdown or demand weakness.

macro.name: AUD/USD exchange rate
macro.note: AUDUSD at 0.6484. AUD remains under pressure. Strong risk-off or persistent US Dollar strength.
macro.action: Favour US Dollar liquidity over AUD assets; watch commodity prices.

macro.name: US 3yr treasury yield
macro.action: Avoid intermediate locks; prefer short/floating rate instruments.

macro.name: US 30yr treasury yield
macro.note: Yield at 4.74%. Elevated long-term yields reflecting fiscal risk/inflation concerns.
macro.action: Watch the 5.0% threshold. Limit long duration locks.

macro.name: US 10yr treasury yield
macro.action: Watch the Atlas pivot at 4.75%; favour short duration.

macro.name: High yield OAS (bps)
macro.note: HY OAS at 3 bps. US credit stress is low and manageable.

macro.name: Treasury net liquidity
macro.note: Net Liquidity at $-6571780B. Liquidity is contracting aggressively. High systemic risk.
macro.action: Aggressively reduce all risk asset exposure and increase cash/SOFR instruments.

micro.name: S&P 500 index
micro.note: S&P 500 Index at 6,720. Strong/stable price action. Low systemic equity risk.

micro.name: ASX 200 index
micro.note: ASX 200 Index at 8,828. Stable price action.

micro.name: Put/Call ratio (PCCE)
micro.note: PCEE Ratio at 0.50. Low hedging (call-buying dominance). High complacency/bullish sentiment.
micro.action: Implement small hedges; avoid chasing market highs.

micro.name: FINRA margin debt (YOY %)
micro.note: Margin Debt YOY at 32.9%. Leverage is expanding aggressively. High risk of forced liquidation if markets fall.
micro.action: Aggressively deleverage equity exposure; increase cash.

micro.name: Small/Large cap ratio
micro.note: Ratio at 0.3599 — small-caps are heavily underperforming. Poor internals.

micro.name: SOFR OIS Spread (bps)
micro.note: SOFR/OIS spread is -5.0 bps. Dollar funding market is stable.

micro.name: Bank CDS index (bps)
micro.note: Bank CDS at 5 bps. Low implied banking stress.

micro.name: Consumer delinquencies
micro.note: Delinquency Rate at 3.0%. Rate is rising. Caution warranted for banks and consumer sectors.
micro.action: Monitor household debt metrics closely; reduce unsecured credit exposure.

overall.comment: Market stability deteriorating rapidly. High caution required.
overall.daily_narrative: Global markets are grappling with significant uncertainty, as evidenced by central bank actions and commentary. The Bank of England, for instance, opted to hold rates steady at 4% in a "knife-edge decision" [Bank of England keeps rates on hold at 4% in knife-edge decision](https://www.ft.com/content/8ae7781b-729a-4226-aae3-4e70aebbe995), diverging from the Federal Reserve's continued focus on inflation as a primary concern [Fed's Hammack Says Inflation a Bigger Concern than Labor Market ...](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-06/fed-s-hammack-says-inflation-a-bigger-concern-than-labor-market). This divergence and the Swedish Riksbank's acknowledgment of an "uncertain" economic outlook [Swedish Riksbank's Thedeen says outlook for economic activity and ...](https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/swedish-riksbanks-thedeen-says-outlook-economic-activity-inflation-is-uncertain-2025-11-06/) contribute to a broader sentiment where "UncertAInty slams risk appetite" [TRADING DAY UncertAInty slams risk appetite | Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/global-markets-trading-day-graphic-2025-11-06/). This external environment of cautious central bank policy and heightened global uncertainty directly reinforces Atlas's current posture of SEVERE RISK.Internally, Atlas's Composite Score of 10.50, indicating SEVERE RISK, is primarily driven by critical systemic vulnerabilities in Liquidity and Leverage. Specifically, "Treasury net liquidity" registers a deep Red with a score of 2.00, signaling significant stress in the financial system's plumbing. Concurrently, "FINRA margin debt (YOY %)" is also Red with a score of 1.50, highlighting excessive leverage building within the market. This elevated risk posture exists despite a relatively subdued VIX index at 19.50 (Amber), suggesting a potential complacency in volatility pricing that belies underlying systemic fragility. The next critical pivot point for Atlas to declare a FULL-STORM risk level would be a breach of the US 10-Year Yield threshold at 4.75% or the High Yield OAS surpassing 400 bps.
overall.composite_summary: Atlas signals a SEVERE RISK environment, driven by deteriorating systemic liquidity and elevated market leverage, demanding immediate defensive positioning.
key_actions: Reduce exposure to risk assets, particularly small-cap equities, given the Red status of the Small/Large cap ratio.
Increase allocation to cash and short-duration fixed income to enhance portfolio liquidity and reduce interest rate sensitivity.
Review and de-risk any outstanding margin positions, as "FINRA margin debt" indicates significant leverage in the system.
Implement hedges against potential increases in the US 10-Year Treasury yield, given its proximity to the 4.75% pivot threshold.
Closely monitor credit spreads, specifically the High Yield OAS, for any signs of widening towards the 400 bps Full-Storm threshold.
